page.title: 01DESCRITION OF BLOCK
page.content:
This block is divided into two distinct parts. To the west is the meandering Irwell valley following the line of an important geological fault. Along the north south axis of this valley it was possible to mine coal. Today all that remains of this coal industry is the Agecroft Mine, one of the largest mines left in the Lancashire Coalfield. It is a modern pit with most of the coal being used for electricity in the nearby power station.
Just as the coal industry declined so did the cotton textile industry which took advantage of the nearby Irwell and the Bolton Bury Canal. As a result much of the western area is occupied by disused factories and derelict
